result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle E Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $25 per month commencing 7/1/22 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Cost to be paid along with Fine payments.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Court grants 2 days credit.
TIME SERVED

records.addlTxt:
Judgment for Unpaid Fines addressed to: Kyle Johnson 
Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle E Johnson
Current: UNKNOWN,   (Effective: 08-19-2022)
Prior: 571 County Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States
Letter from Atty Anna Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:24 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Kyle E Johnson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire as been filed and inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Kees confirms her client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Kees confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty if Count 2.  Court orders Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Kees.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:
2 Days Jail (Credit - 2 days) - TIME SERVED.

FINE:  $363.25;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 07/01/2022. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered;  filed by Atty. Anna Kees

Letter filed by Atty Kees requesting the hearing be converted to a Plea and Sentencing.
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 05-02-22.** Request granted

addressed to: Kyle Johnson for hearing on 05-26-22

Hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:42 AM Defendant Kyle E Johnson in court, in custody, with Cuca Longoria, under the Student Practice Rule, for attorney Anna M Kees.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant can be returned forthwith to Green Lake County Jail.  Once this case has been reassigned the parties will receive notice of the next date.

Request for Substitution against Judge Michael O. Bohren , received on 04/07/2022. Filed by Atty Anna M Kees .

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on 04/08/2022: Denied, not signed by an attorney or party
filed, to be produced from Green Lake County Jail
